title: With the new lore can we get some likable villains?

replies.body: Honestly, the villain in League is who you find them to be. Some people think Viktor is a huge villain, and cite Jayce's lore for that. Some people defend him with his own and Blitz's lore. Most of it is just personal preference.

>Honestly, the villain in League is who ***you*** find them to be.

{{champion:86}} would like a word with you.
> Would like a Demacia with you

{{champion:412}}

Sure he's a complete and utter monster who tortures people for eternity, but he's just so gosh-darn _charming_.
No wonder why Senna left.
Too soon.{{champion:236}} {{item:3070}}
100% wifesteal.

It'd be really nice if Riot added something in the lore to push {{champion:112}} back and place him in the gray area again, instead of pushing him towards an A-hole murderous villain like they're doing now.
I am not sure he even qualifies as a villain, since he's never done anything that can constitute as villainy.
Let's see he has broken into jayces lab and had stolen ahigh tech crystal of power

He did ask nicely first, which is more than can be said for most villains. Even so, what he did was rude rather than evil; Jayce was left unharmed when he could have been killed to ensure his silence.

And you have it backwards; Viktor politely knocked on Jayce's front door, it was the Defender of Tomorrow that broke into _Viktor's_ lab.
I don't know about calling it just rude.  Theft is usually considered a crime even if it is non-violent and you leave them a thank you note.

His whole character is about a guy that wants everyone to be like him and join his "glorious evolution". Sounds like a classic villian if you ask me, even he if is not one, he just needs a little push to be one.
But why should he be pushed towards a generic villain like that? It would be a big waste of his character. The guy even wanted to clean Zaun while he was a student.

Half of the champions you mentioned are not even close to being villains man... Draven, Diana, Sejuani and even MF are misunderstood and quite relateable. They are... Right?

Draven executes "guilty" prisioners for a living, that itself is not villianous. His attitude towards it is though. Sejuany is the only hope for the freiljord once Lissandra's plan starts moving forward, yet she is ruthless and brutal. Mf's parents were killed by Gangplank, yet after she "killed" him she still went out of her way to also murder every single person who had sided with him. Read her new story in the website.  Diana was called a heretic and was almost executed by those she trusted, yet once she was free she swore to kill every single one of the Solari, even those who had nothing to do with her execution. One thing is for sure, they are definitely NOT heroes.

{{champion:222}} Jinx is a pretty harmless villain, if she counts. She's destructive and chaotic, but she never really has any bad intentions. 
{{champion:25}} Morgana can be seen as a villain, she fell from grace and turned to dark magic to regain power. She doesn't get along with her sister, but otherwise she's a pretty nice person. She runs her own bakery outside of the league, that's pretty innocent in itself.

I guess it just sort of depends on what someone considers a villain.

"Rules are made to be broken... like buildings! Or people!"

Jinx's utter disregard for life and property is almost textbook evil. Sure, she might not specifically go out of her way to kill others, but that doesn't mean she's any less evil.

Morgana is not the slightest bit canonically evil. If anything Kayle is evil. Morgana did nothing wrong, she simply refused to take part in a conflict and Kayle shunned her because of it. Kayle seems to be one of those self-righteous people who turns out to be the tyrannical villain.

Jinx? Harmless? Probably not. Considering, like others have said, her disregard for life shes probably killed SOME people when she was out blowing shit up. She IS kinda likeable, not in the sense of "I can relate to her and understand where shes coming from" (unless you do, im not judging), but more in the sense that "I hate her but shes so funny", kinda like Handsome Jack

One of Jinx's quotes is literally "I have the best intentions...said no one ever."
She does not have good intentions, and she's pretty harmful, with destroying buildings and people.

"Lets just behave... said no one ever"

That's the actual quote.
Jinx is a textbook definition of Chaotic Evil. Her only motivations are to destroy things and kill people.

> Jinx is a textbook definition of Chaotic Evil. Her only motivations are to destroy things and kill people.

Riot says she's Chaotic Neutral.

Also, by Dungeons and Dragons standards, a character who is _completely and utterly insane_ can only be Chaotic Neutral, because they don't know right from wrong. Now, I'm no psychiatrist, but Jinx seems pretty insane.

Chaotic Evil people _know_ they're doing wrong, and _enjoy it_ {{champion:45}}


Also on the Demaica/Noxus thing:

Demacia is, essentially, a Fascist Monarchy nation.
Noxus is a Meritocracy (or definitely on it's way to becoming one. If Darius had his way it already would be.). The problem with Noxus is the fact that the people in power are a bunch of _assholes_

How can you _not_ like {{champion:45}}?!

Sure, he is unabashedly evil, but he suffered legitimate trauma and is just so ridiculously over-the-top his villainy wraps around to comedy relief. No one takes him seriously and he _hates_ it with a volatile passion.

You want to root the enemies for Veigar so he can land his combo.

Well, Xerath USED to be a tragic villain that people could really feel for, but instead, he was retconned into a mustache twirling Saturday morning villain.

I would say he is still pretty tragic, considering he was acting out of spite that had been building for years, and when he realized the level of destruction his actions would cause _after_ Azir had given him, and every other slave in Shurima, freedom, he tried to avert disaster as best he could. Instead, the world he knew was reduced to dust, given power he never asked for, and vilified for his mistakes.

I don't think black and white characterization is one of the things that LoL suffers from. In fact most of the characters are shades of gray with a new outliers being completely malevolent or benevolent

Riven worked for Noxus, only really left because she got bombed, not because she disagreed with the ideals.

Heck, She hates Swain and Singed, and so does Katarina. 

Vayne's a criminal vigilante law-breaking, but like Batman, we support her.
